title: Precision typography
content:
well... this is good typography... or?  
: )

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100103052748im_/http:/typophile.com/files/precision_3462.jpg)

found here [www.laurabarnard.co.uk/blog/](http://web.archive.org/web/20100103052748/http:/www.laurabarnard.co.uk/blog/ "www.laurabarnard.co.uk/blog/")
author: rosmedia

comments.content: Maybe it WAS good... that is until it was given to a slacker on a ladder to slap those letters up.

More Typoantonyms:  
 [Connectie](http://web.archive.org/web/20100103052748/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/letterror/2940387361/), found by LettError  
 [Finer Points in the Spacing and Arrangement of Type](http://web.archive.org/web/20100103052748/http:/www.typography.com/ask/showBlog.php?blogID=67), on the H&FJ blog  
 [Venetian](http://web.archive.org/web/20100103052748/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/48413419@N00/222341696/), from Hrant  
 [Antiqua](http://web.archive.org/web/20100103052748/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/typeoff/286128127/), seen by Dan

ha ha..  
well it loox like perfection is not easy!

ha ha..  
your killing me, Nick!!  
Great find..  
: )
Well, he said to “Get the L out.”
